2b53272e36044a9eaac26e9e8c2af404,NM-AN2200-22-00111,NM-AN2200-22-00111   2021-2022 49RF Rolls Royce Pub,NOTICE OF INTENT TO NEGOTIATE A SOLE-SOURCE CONTRACT

The US Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Marine and Aviation Operations (OMAO), NOAA AOC owns/operates one Gulfstream IV (G-IV) aircraft with the following FAA registration and serial number: N49RF – S/N 1246. The NOAA Aircraft Operations Center (AOC) located at Lakeland, Florida, manages its G-IV in accordance with Federal Aviation Regulations (FAR) Part 91. This statement of need is to provide annual technical publication renewal subscription services for one (1) GIV Rolls-Royce Engine Manual.
The service will be conducted by:

570219634 ROLLS-ROYCE MILITARY AERO ENGINES LIMITED plc The Lombard Building (SinA-54), Victory Rd, Derby, DE24 8BJ, UK. To provide TAY GIV/GIV-SP (G300/G400) Maintenance Data (Download and Rolls-Royce Care).
The North American Industry Classification Code (NAICS) for this acquisition is 336413, Other Aircraft Part and Auxiliary Equipment Manufacturing; the small business size standard is 1,250 Employees.

It is a FAR Part 91 requirement to reference the most current aircraft manuals. The current subscription services expire on December 31, 2021.  AOC requires up to date Rolls Royce Tay 611-8 engine manuals and technical publication services including access to the Rolls-Royce Care website. The manuals and website are a requirement for using the GIV engines in flight. The Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM), Rolls Royce, is the only vendor capable of providing these technical publication services, which includes access to their proprietary website.

The Government is not aware of any other vendors that are authorized to provide, service, or support this TAY GIV/GIV-SP (G300/G400) Maintenance subscription without compromising OEM delivery, or additional markups. Rolls-Royce is the manufacturer of the aircraft for which these manuals are required.

The Government intends to acquire this service under the guidelines of FAR Part 13, Simplified Acquisitions Procedures and FAR Part 12, Commercial Items. The Government intends to solicit and negotiate directly with Rolls-Royce, under the authority of FAR 13.106-1(b)(1)(i).

This is not a solicitation for competitive quotes. However, if any authorized party that can provide this subscription/licensing without compromising manufacturing delivery or mark ups may submit a statement of capabilities, which if in timely received, will be considered by NOAA OMAO.

A statement of capabilities to include the detailed service including manufacture authorization, and OEM agreement, and a price list, this shall be received by 8:00am EST on December 28, 2021. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed requirement is based upon responses to this notice and it is solely within the discretion of the Government.

Information received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement in the future. Evidence must be provided of the required service while also be authorized by the manufacture.

The capability statement, a price list and any other information furnished must be in writing and must contain material in sufficient detail to allow the Government to determine if the party can meet all of the system requirements. Capability statements and related materials must be e-mailed to Christopher Baker at Christopher.Baker@noaa.gov by 8:00am EST on December 28, 2021.

(JSSI) located at 180 N Stetson 29TH Floor, Chicago, Illinois 60601-6704, for a firm-fixed price contract for leased Rolls Royce Tay 611-8 engines to replace the existing Rolls Royce Tay 611-8 engines (S/N 16613 and 16610) currently installed on NOAA Gulfstream G-IV aircraft. The leasing terms are required to consist of between 12-24 months, based on the best interest of the Government and AOC needs, to be installed in approximately March – May of 2023. Based on the Request for Information (RFI) responses received, JSSI was determined to be the only capable vendor that met the requirements and could provide the leasing options necessary to successfully perform this requirement.

2fe138391fec4151ba82b1e69e033503,C20C37DepotMaintenance,C20/C37 Depot Maintenance,"C-20/C-37 Depot Maintenance

THERE IS NO SOLICITATION AVAILABLE AT THIS TIME.  REQUESTS FOR A SOLICITATION WILL NOT RECEIVE A RESPONSE.   This Sources Sought Synopsis (SSS) is in support of Market Research being conducted by the United States Air Force (USAF) to identify potential sources to perform C-20/C-37 Depot Maintenance.  This is not a Request for Proposal (RFP) or solicitation.

Program Description:  The C-20/C-37 platforms are militarized versions of the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) airworthiness-certificated Gulfstream aircraft.  The C-20/C-37 fleets are maintained to FAA-approved maintenance standards.  All depot maintenance and repairable spares repair is performed at a Federal Aviation Regulation (FAR) Part 145 FAA-certified repair stations. Depot Maintenance would require collaboration with Gulfstream Aerospace, as they are currently on contract to provide most spare parts in support of the Depot Maintenance.  The C-20 is a Gulfstream GIV, powered by twin Rolls Royce MK-611 TAY engines.  The C-37 is a Gulfstream GV and G550, powered by twin Rolls Royce BR-710 engines. C-37 engines are currently supported through Rolls Royce Corporate Care Program. Contractor will be required to do general engine maintenance but overhauls are accomplished through Rolls Royce. These aircraft are equipped with specialized mission communication stations (MCS) as well as defensive systems.  The C-20/C-37 missions are two-fold: (1) provide worldwide airlift support for senior military leaders and Government officials; (2) Navy and Marine C-20G aircraft, equipped with a cargo door, to primarily provide long range, medium airlift, logistics support. Contractors shall be required to gain Computerized Maintenance Program (CMP) access. CMP is the fleet configuration control program and all maintenance actions, serialized control tracked items, and information must be entered into the system to certify maintenance completion. The fleet is projected to require 10+ scheduled depot inductions per year with up to 5 aircraft inducted simultaneously.  There is also potential for unscheduled depot drop-ins during this time period.

In addition, all contractor workforce personnel who are required to handle Controlled Cryptographic Items (CCI) marked as CRYPTO on C-20 and C-37 aircraft must possess and maintain a SECRET security clearance.

Any resultant contract would be considered a service contract where the Service Contract Labor Standard applies and would require the DFARs 252.223-7999, Ensuring Adequate COVID-19 Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors (Deviation 2021-O0009).
Request For Information:

column2: Are you a FAA Part 145 certificated repair facility for Gulfstream GIV, GV, and G550 airframes & engines?  Do you currently perform depot level maintenance on Gulfstream GIV, GV, and G550 per the aircraft maintenance manual Chapter 5 requirements?  Describe how and where you currently are accomplishing those tasks to include explanation of access to required data.

Depot Capacity – Do you currently have the maintenance manpower and hanger capacity to accomplish 10+ depots per year with the possibility of having up to 5 aircraft inducted simultaneously?  Describe your approach to meet this depot capacity requirement.

Landing Gear Overhaul – Do you currently perform or have the capability to perform Gulfstream GIV, GV, and G550 nose landing gear (NLG) and main landing gear (MLG) overhauls?  Describe your approach to accomplish MLG and NLG overhaul requirements.

APU – Are you a FAA Part 145 certificated repair facility and currently have the capability to perform C-20 Honeywell model GTCP36-150(G) and C-37 Honeywell model RE220 APU repairs and overhauls?  Describe your approach to accomplish APU repairs & overhauls.

C-20 Engines - Are you a FAA Part 145 certificated repair facility and currently have the capability to perform C-20 Rolls Royce MK-611 TAY engine repairs and overhauls?  Describe your approach to accomplish C-20 engine repairs & overhauls.

Service Bulletins – Do you currently accomplish OEM and vendor released service bulletins (Customer Bulletin (CB), Alert Customer Bulletin (ACB), Aircraft Service Change (ASC), Airworthiness Directives (AD), etc…) and associated USAF released Time Compliance Tech Orders (TCTO) required for inspections or maintenance actions to maintain FAA compliance?  Describe your approach to accomplish service bulletins to include explanation of access to required data.
Classified Information & Equipment – Do you currently have a COMSEC account to store/handle Controlled Cryptographic Items (CCI)?

Will you as the prime, as well as any service subcontractors, be willing to accept the clause at DFARs 252.223-7999, Ensuring Adequate COVID-19 Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors (Deviation 2021-O0009)

Do you have means to attain the necessary licensing agreement with the required OEMs to perform all the tasks above? Please describe your relationship with the applicable OEMs and how you plan to accomplish these tasks.

eedb056546ea419c92427641e25c0ce3,RFI-GULFSTREAMGIII,Sources Sought - Gulfstream GIII aircraft for maintenance and inspection,Sources Sought For Gulfstream GIII Aircraft for Maintenance and Inspection
General Description

NASA LaRC is hereby soliciting information for potential sources to provide maintenance and inspection of a Gulfstream GIII aircraft. The estimated general scope and high-level specification of the deliverables are outlined below.
Scope of Work

NASA requires specific maintenance inspections to be completed.  NASA will deliver the aircraft for repair within 15 days of contract award.  An itemized list of all Gulfstream Computerized Maintenance Program (CMP) Codes is provided under the Work Requirements section of this SOW and shall be completed for the base effort. During completion of the maintenance items listed below (Line Item 1), if additional repairs are needed, the Contractor shall only perform the effort in accordance with Line Item 2 below.

NASA LaRC representative has authority to conduct a pre-award Site Visit/Survey at the vendor`s facility to ensure compliance with industry standards if needed as determined by the Government.  Otherwise, verification of required programs will be validated upon delivery of aircraft.
Work Requirements – Line item 1

1. During the period of performance, the Government shall have access to the Vendor`s maintenance facilities and the Government-provided aircraft for on-site inspections and oversight of work being performed.  On-site oversight is a requirement of NASA Policies NPR 7900.3D and NPR 8735.2B. The requirement of Government oversight is provided in addition to, not as a substitute for, the vendor’s organization’s responsibilities relating to inspection, quality control, and quality assurance.
2. The vendor shall have a documented Tool Control Program.
3. The vendor shall have a documented Foreign Object Debris (FOD) Program.
4. The work described in this SOW must be completed In Accordance With (IAW) the current manufacturer`s applicable technical data/publication and the Vendor`s repair station approved processes.

5. The vendor shall provide the LaRC POC with weekly progress updates to include: discrepancies found, completed inspections, schedule adjustments, and part requirements. This report can be verbal or delivered electronically in contractor format.

7. Upon completion of any CMP Task Code, CB, or AD, the vendor shall submit correctly completed associated paperwork to CMP for record updating and tracking.

8. A complete Portfolio of all maintenance accomplished shall be provided 3 business days prior to the Flight Readiness Review (FRR) (see paragraph 10 below).  The portfolio shall include: documentation of all work accomplished, CMP Task Cards, NDI reports as required, and approved FAA Form 8130-3 Airworthiness Approval Tags/Certificate of Conformance/Material Certification for all vendor acquired parts replaced, and itemized invoicing for all work accomplished beyond the original contracted work. Maintenance documentation records will, at a minimum, contain a complete description of the maintenance/repair/replacement/inspection/Non-Destructive Inspections (NDI) accomplished, the date, certification number, type of certificate held by the person or company performing the work, and technical manual and paragraph information references.

9. The vendor shall provide a representative for a Flight Readiness Review to speak on behalf of all maintenance accomplished. The review focuses on the flight operational safety aspects of a specific aircraft flight after an alternation, modification, repair, or maintenance has been accomplished. The review may be conducted via a teleconference.

10. NASA LaRC may perform a Functional Check Flight (FCF) at the vendor`s location after the completion of the maintenance flight release review, if required.  The vendor shall assist NASA LaRC personnel with aircraft preparation for FCF (as required) and departure from vendor facility.
11. The vendor shall provide electronic copies of all documents in PDF format.
12. Deliverables

column2: Portfolio. See Item 8 above.
Forms 8130-3 as required. See Item 8 above.

column1: Specific requirements will be included in a subsequent request for quotes (RFQ).

Interested sources shall provide capabilities/product information on meeting the scope of the request and show prior experience in maintenance and inspection of a Gulfstream GIII aircraft. Please limit responses to no more than 20 pages in length. Please provide a brief outline of the company’s business sector(s) including business size (e.g. Small Business, Other Than Small Business), Primary North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) Code, DUNS Number or System for Award Management (SAM) registration number, if applicable. Also, please provide whether the likely products used have been sold in the commercial marketplace or only to Government entities.

This request for information is for market research and planning purposes only and is not to be construed as a commitment by the Government, nor will the Government pay for information solicited. Respondents will not be notified of any results of information collected. The information provided will assist the Government in its assessment of the current market and help develop and define the request for proposal for these systems.
Please submit responses by COB November 22nd. Email responses to: jo.rolfe@nasa.gov and lakhassia.y.mccoy@nasa.gov.

c486879f60234cac8299fadab0317110,70Z02321RLRC006,Gulfstream Brake and Wheel Assembly Parts,"This is NOT a Request for Proposal (RFP).  This is a notice of the Government’s intent to issue a sole source award contract to Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation for the procurement of two Gulfstream G550 Brake Assembly and MLG Wheel Assembly parts for the C-37B aircraft.  This procurement is essential to ensure the USCG maintains capabilities to adequately support operational readiness for aircraft stationed at Air Station Washington.  The USCG announces its intent to enter into a contract award on a sole source basis with Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation the authority of 10 U.S.C. 2304(c)(1): Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services will Satisfy Agency Requirements.

The specific requirements that makes Gulstream Aerospace Corporation the only responsible source is that they are the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) of the Brake and Wheel Assembly parts has not sold the manufacturing, technical data, specifications, or drawing to any other vendor or the US Government.  Further, the USCG engineering community has determined the Gulfstream main battery are the only components that satisfies USCG requirements.

Respondents are advised that the USCG will not pay for any information or administrative costs incurred in response to this notice.  All costs associated with responding to this notice will be solely at the responding party’s expense.

This notice of intent is NOT a request for proposals or quotations.  Information received will be considered solely for the purposes of determining whether conducting a competitive procurement is in the best interest of the Government. For specific questions, please contact Patricia Willett, at Patricia.S.Willett@uscg.mil.

d3d8fc25d6d14c2d87b4042cdf8ed50a,1305M2-21-Q-01711,Airborne Waveguide Pressurization System model AWPS20,NOAA Office of Marine and Aviation Operations

This is a Sources Sought Notice in preparation for an upcoming procurement, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Eastern Acquisition Division, Norfolk, VA on behalf of the NOAA Office of Marine and Aviation Operations (OMAO), Aircraft Operations Center (AOC) is conducting market research to determine potential sources for an Airborne Waveguide Pressurization System Model AWPS20 manufactured by Cibred SUD. The North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code is 334511 Radar Systems and Equipment Manufacturing. The size standard for this NAICS codes is 1,250 employees.
The information provided by vendors shall be used to evaluate potential resources interested and capable of providing the AWPS20 to NOAA’s OMAO/AOC.

The AOC operates one Lockheed Gulfstream aircraft in support of NOAA and national research. AOC needs to acquire a spare tail doppler radar (TDR) airborne waveguide pressurization system (model: AWPS20, part number: C13916). The TDR is a scientific measurement instrument that is mounted on the tail of the aircraft and is used to collect data on atmospheric phenomenon. The National Hurricane Center (NHC) uses data collected on tropical cyclone systems to fulfill its functions mandated in the National Hurricane Operations Plan (NHOP). NOAA AOC does not own a spare unit and needs to acquire one so that it can continue to provide these critical data to NHC in case of a failure of the unit installed on the aircraft.
The manufacturer:
Cibred SUD s.r.l.
Via Catania, 2
Loc. Pavona 00041 Albano Laziale
(Roma) Italy
The required Cibred SUD part number is C13916 for an Airborne Waveguide Pressurization System model AWPS20.

•Company point of contact including name, phone number, and e-mail address.

Documentation Comments: In order to facilitate the exchange of information with industry, provide any comments, questions, or suggestions that pertain to the draft PWS included with this notice. Identify any areas that appear ambiguous or otherwise unclear.

Interested vendors are invited to submit an electronic response to this Sources Sought Notice to Natasha Thieman, Contract Specialist, via e-mail at Natasha.Thieman@noaa.gov no later than 11 a.m. Eastern on August 2, 2021. Capability Statements and Documentation Comments must be submitted in writing; telephonic inquiries will not receive a response.

This is not a request for technical or cost proposals. The Government does not intend to award a contract on the basis of this notice or reimburse for costs incurred by interested parties providing the information requested herein. No collect calls will be accepted.

This notice is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice.

This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; offers are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2020-05. The Government intends to acquire commercial items and services using the provisions, clauses and procedures prescribed in FAR Part 12 and FAR Part 13.
This is a Request for Quotations (RFQ), 80NSSC21774918Q. Additional details are included in the attached RFQ file. The attached RFQ file is hereby incorporated into this solicitation.
Delivery is FOB Destination.
This Procurement is Set Aside for Small Business
The NAICS Code for this procurement is 336413

All responsible sources may submit a quote which shall be considered by the agency. However, any award from this RFQ shall require the potential vendor to be certified within the System for Award Management System (SAM) and completion of Reps and Certs in the SAM system prior to award at www.sam.gov.

Quotes for the item(s) described in the RFQ are due by 7/20/2021 by 2:00 p.m. CT to Gary Walker at Gary.W.Walker@nasa.gov in order to be considered for award. If it is in the best interest of the Government, quotes submitted after the due date may be accepted.
If the end product offered is other than a domestic end product as defined in the clause entitled "Buy American Act -- Supplies," the offeror shall so state and shall list the country of origin.
All contractual and technical questions must be in writing (e-mail) to Gary Walker at Gary.W.Walker@nasa.gov no later than 7/20/2021 by 12 Noon p.m. CT. Telephone questions shall not be accepted.

The following clauses and provisions are applicable to this combined synopsis/solicitation: 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors; 52.212-3 Offeror Representations and Certifications—Commercial Items; 52.212-4 Contract Terms and Conditions—Commercial Items; 52-212-5
Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders— Commercial Items.
NASA Clause 1852.215-84, Ombudsman, is applicable. The Center Ombudsman for this acquisition can be found at http://prod.nais.nasa.gov/pub/pub_library/Omb.html .

http://www.acquisition.gov/far/index.html

e4a9d0d0716645a5ba954e78026b3102,NM-AN2200-21-01393,NM-AN2200-21-01393 DMT Cloud Probe Calibration Service,NOTICE OF INTENT TO NEGOTIATE A SOLE-SOURCE CONTRACT

The US Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Marine and Aviation Operations (OMAO), NOAA Aircraft Operations Center owns and maintains aircraft cloud physics probes. These are specialized science instrumentation packages, designed to collect airborne data on cloud atmospherics. The cloud physics instrumentation package is part of NOAA’s standard aircraft scientific equipment, and is necessary for quality data acquisition to support incoming scientific projects.  This requisition is to provide calibration, optics cleaning for one Precipitation Imaging Probes (PIP), two Cloud Combination Probes (CCP) and one Cloud Aerosol Spectrometer (CAS).
The service will be conducted by: Droplet Measurement Technologies  2400 Trade Centre Avenue  Longmont, CO 80503  To provide calibration and maintenance for its cloud physics probes.
The North American Industry Classification Code (NAICS) for this acquisition is 336413, Other Aircraft Part and Auxiliary Equipment Manufacturing; the small business size standard is 1,250 Employees.
Calibration of one Precipitation Imaging Probe (PIP) 2.1.1. Provide service evaluation for incoming PIP probe
Provide maintenance and calibration for PIP probe based on the service evaluation
Calibration of two Cloud Combination Probes (CCP) 2.2.1. Provide service evaluation for incoming CCP probe
Provide maintenance and calibration for CCP probe based on the service evaluation
Calibration of one Cloud Aerosol Spectrometer (CAS) 2.3.1. Provide service evaluation for incoming CAS probe
Provide maintenance and calibration for CAS probe based on the service evaluation

The Government is not aware of any other vendors that are authorized to provide, service, or support these Cloud probes without compromising OEM delivery, or additional markups. Droplet Measurement Technologies (DMT) is the manufacturer of the Cloud and Aerosol Spectrometer (CAS).  DMT holds the patents and all proprietary engineering and manufacturing documents.

The Government intends to acquire this service under the guidelines of FAR Part 13, Simplified Acquisitions Procedures and FAR Part 12, Commercial Items. The Government intends to solicit and negotiate directly with Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation, under the authority of FAR 13.106-1(b)(1)(i).

This is not a solicitation for competitive quotes. However, if any authorized party that can provide this subscription/licensing without compromising manufacturing delivery or mark ups may submit a statement of capabilities, which if in timely received, will be considered by NOAA OMAO.

A statement of capabilities to include the detailed service including manufacture authorization, and OEM agreement, and a price list, this shall be received by 8:00am EST on July 6, 2021. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed requirement is based upon responses to this notice and it is solely within the discretion of the Government.

Information received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement in the future. Evidence must be provided of the required service while also be authorized by the manufacture.

c5c92e1fd0754257a7022af0ec9cac9e,1305M219DNMAN0009-6-14-2021,NOTICE OF INTENT TO NEGOTIATE A SOLE-SOURCE CONTRACT FOR GULFSTREAM GIV-SP FULL SERVICE MAINTENANCE SUPPORT AND SERVICES,"NOTICE OF INTENT TO AWARD A SOLE-SOURCE CONTRACT

The U.S. Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Eastern Acquisition Division (EAD) in Norfolk, VA, , intends to negotiate a sole source contract modification to extend the ordering period under an Indefinite Delivery, Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract with Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation for the Office of Marine and Aviation Operations (OMAO), Aircraft Operations Center (AOC) Gulfstream IV-SP (G-IV) using the procedures in FAR Subpart 13.5, Simplified Procedures for Certain Commercial Items.. The contractor’s mailing address is located at Mailstop R-4B, PO Box 2206, Savannah, GA 31402. The additional one-year ordering period will provide full service maintenance support and services for the extensively modified NOAA G-IV (S/N 1246).
Background

The NOAA/OMAO/AOC owns and operates a Gulfstream IV-SP, S/N 1246 and Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) registration N49RF, for the purpose of high altitude weather research. The primary mission is for tropical cyclone surveillance, research, and reconnaissance during the hurricane season starting 01 June and ending 30 November every year. The aircraft is based at Lakeland Linder Regional Airport in Lakeland, FL, and operates world-wide in tropical, as well as Arctic, environments. The aircraft was purchased new in 1995 and underwent several scientific and instrumentation modifications to meet NOAA’s mission requirements. The aircraft has a unique configuration and is unlike any commercially available Gulfstream IV-SP. NOAA/OMAO/AOC requires Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation to perform required maintenance for its Gulfstream IV-SP (S/N 1246) and additional 24-hour/7-days a week support for unscheduled maintenance and Aircraft On Ground (AOG) occurrences as currently provided under the IDIQ 1305M219DNMAN0009.
Information

The North American Industry Classification Code (NAICS) for this acquisition is 488190, Other Support Activities for Air Transportation, with a business size standard of $35.0 million. This is not a solicitation for competitive quotes. However, if any other interested party believes that it can meet the requirements, it may submit a statement of capabilities, which if timely received, will be considered by NOAA. A statement of capabilities must be received by 12:00 PM EST on June 18, 2021. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed requirement based upon responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government. Information received will also be considered for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement in the future. A submitted statement of capabilities must include evidence of the firm’s ability to provide the required services at the locations and within the timeframes/schedule specified in the current IDIQ contract. The capability statement and any other information furnished must be in writing and must contain material in sufficient detail to allow NOAA to determine if the party can meet all of the requirements. Capability statements and related materials must be e-mailed to James Jarrett Skaggs at james.skaggs@noaa.gov (Cc ashley.perry@noaa.gov) by 12:00 PM EST on June 18, 2021.

8538db4c210846ee913bdf921e483134,70Z02321RCLRC003,Tactical Air Communication and Navigation (TACAN) Transceiver,"This is NOT a Request for Proposal (RFP).  This is a notice of the Government’s intent to issue a sole source award contract to Intertrade, A Collins Aerospace Company for the procurement of a TACAN transceiver for the C-37B aircraft.  The TACAN is an identification friend or foe (IFF) system and is required to support the C-37B Commandant Gulfstream Aircraft.  The use of this system provides standardization and commonality among U.S. Coast Guard Aircraft.  The USCG announces its intent to enter into a contract award on a sole source basis with Intertrade, A Collins Aerospace Company under the authority of 10 U.S.C. 2304(c)(1): Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services will Satisfy Agency Requirements.

The specific requirements that makes Intertrade, A Collins Aerospace Company the only contractor capable of providing the TACAN transceiver is that they are the OEM of this system.  To procure this system from another manufacturer would delay production and along with the cost of developing all new software to meet the current TACAN specifications, would be cost prohibitive.

Respondents are advised that the USCG will not pay for any information or administrative costs incurred in response to this notice.  All costs associated with responding to this notice will be solely at the responding party’s expense.

This notice of intent is NOT a request for proposals or quotations.  Information received will be considered solely for the purposes of determining whether conducting a competitive procurement is in the best interest of the Government. For specific questions, please contact Patricia Willett, at Patricia.S.Willett@uscg.mil.

The Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Acquisition and Grants Office (AGO), Eastern Acquisition Division (EAD) is seeking information from industry in order to inform NOAA on capable providers of aircraft maintenance services for NOAA’s Gulfstream G-IV.

The anticipated NAICS code for this requirement is 488190– Other Support Activities for Air Transportation with a size standard of $32,500,000.00.  The Government requests capability statements from interested sources that address the below requirements.

All interested sources shall submit a capability statement that shall be considered by the agency. To be eligible, vendors must be registered with the System for Award Management (SAM): https://www.sam.gov/portal/public/SAM/##11. Interested sources can obtain a DUNS number by calling 1-800-333-0505. Capability statements will be due on January 26, 2021 by 12:00PM ET. Capability statements shall not exceed 15 pages in total. Capability statements will be accepted electronically (using PDF or Microsoft Word) at the following email address: Jonathan.Sayoc@noaa.gov.
Submitted capability statement shall include the following:

column2: Company name and address
DUNS number

Size of business according to NAICS 334519 (e.g. Large Business, Small Business, 8a, Veteran Owned Small Business, Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business, HubZone, Small Disadvantaged Business, or Woman Owned Small Business) as validated by SAM.
Company point of contact – Name, Phone Number, and Email Address

column1: General Requirements:

The contractor shall perform scheduled aircraft inspections, maintenance, repair and modifications at the contractor's facility or at the NOAA Aircraft Operations Center (AOC) in Lakeland, FL. In addition, the contractor shall provide and supply parts and technical support during unscheduled maintenance with the aircraft on ground (AOG) in any location away from the contract maintenance facility. The contractor shall perform all inspections, maintenance, repair and modifications when the aircraft arrives at its facility. The aircraft will be flown to the contractor's facility by NOAA personnel prior to commencement of the required maintenance. NOAA requires Aviation Service Changes (ASCs)/Customer Bulletins (CBs), Supplemental Type Certificates (STCs), Airworthiness Directives (ADs), and occasional Engineering and Science modifications to be complied with which shall be done in accordance with all manufacturer's and Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) publications.
Location: Provide information of facility proximity to major airports as well as NOAA Aircraft Operations Center (AOC) in Lakeland, FL

a2e6b4c0e3404a85bf7ae0ed6225e201,70Z02321FLRC00100,USCG C-37B/G550 Gulfstream Aircraft,"The statutory authority permitting other than full and open competition is 10 U.S.C. 2304(c)(1), as implemented by the FAR Subpart 6.302-1, entitled “Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services Will Satisfy Agency Requirements.”
Specifically, FAR 6.302-1 (a)(2)(ii)(A) applies:

(ii) Supplies may be deemed to be available only from the original source in the case of a follow-on contract for the continued development or production of a major system or highly specialized equipment, including major components thereof, when it is likely that award to any other source would result in: (A) Substantial duplication of cost to the Government that is not expected to be recovered through competition.
Justification and Approval is attached.

1ab7eaabf54844c8b34de5b678972f36,NM-AN2200-21-00057,NOAA AOC Airstart Cart,"Combined Synopsis/Solicitation

The U.S. Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Aircraft Operations Center (AOC) at Lakeland, FL operates two WP-3D Orions and a Gulfstream GIV-SP in support of hurricane surveillance and scientific research.

These aircraft’s engines are started through the use of high pressure air. Normally this is supplied through an Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) on the aircraft that can be started on its own power. However, the APUs are starting to fail at a higher rate due to the age of the aircraft. In the event of an APU failure, the engines can still be started with an external Air Start Cart. By procuring an airstart cart unit that would be readily available at all times, AOC can prevent mission delays and continue to meet the critical demands of our hurricane surveillance stakeholders in the event of an APU failure.
The air start unit will not require heavy usage, therefore a serviceable used unit should fulfill the requirements of this request

This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued.
Solicitation number NM-AN2200-21-00057 is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ).
The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2021-01.

Total Small Business set-aside under The North American Industry Classification Code (NAICS) for this acquisition is 333613, Mechanical Power Transmission Equipment Manufacturing; the small business size standard is 750 Employees.
Line items are as follows:
CLIN 0001

This request is to procure aviation support equipment (an airstart cart) capable of delivering engine starting air to the WP-3D Orion and G-IV gulfstream aircraft for the NOAA Aircraft Operations Center.
New or Reconditioned, (OEM Certified Preferred), products will be considered in review.
Place of Delivery:
NOAA
AIRCRAFT OPERATIONS CENTER
3450 FLIGHTLINE DRIVE
LAKELAND FL 33811
Deliver By: Oct 30, 2020 or 30 days ARO
Please see attached Statement of Work for details. Additionally, each offeror must provide the following information with the quote:
The Request for Quote (RFQ) number;
2. The Name, Address, Telephone Number, and DUNS Number of the Offeror;

3. Include a statement specifying the extent of agreement with all terms, conditions, and provisions included in the RFQ. Quotes that reject the terms and conditions of the RFQ may be excluded from consideration;
4. Acknowledgment of Solicitation Amendments (SF-30), if any.

5. Address the ability of meeting the requirements per the Specifications with a detail material specification or data sheet, pictures of the item, and authorized OEM letter to sale or distribute their products.
6. Authorized distributor only for this procurement. 3rd party sales will not be accepted. Documents showing authorization to sale a product shall be provided with the quote.

All responsible sources may submit a quotation which shall be considered by the agency. Quotes must be submitted via electronic means (e-mail) by 1000 (10:00 A.M.) Eastern on October 20, 2020; any award resulting from this RFQ will be made based on the Technical specifications, availability and price. Quotes and other support documentation must be submitted to the Contract Specialist, Christopher Baker at Christopher.Baker@noaa.gov.
Technical Specification is more important than price as this product must meet the agencies needs in marking tools, parts and other material which may take on a unique shape.
All questions must be submitted in writing to Christopher.Baker@noaa.gov by 5:00 P.M. Eastern on October 19,2020. Telephonic requests will not be honored.

Contractors are encouraged to register with the beta.sam.gov, Vendor Notification Service as well as the Interested Vendors List for this acquisition (see applicable tab within beta.sam.gov where this synopsis/solicitation is posted). All interested parties wishing to submit a quote (Quoters) must be registered in the SAM database to be considered for award. Registration is free and can be completed on-line at http://www.sam.gov/.

52.212-5 Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders—Commercial Items (Aug 2020) (Deviation 2020-05) (Apr 2020) (Deviation 2017-05)(Sept 2017)

(d)  Comptroller General Examination of Record. The Contractor shall comply with the provisions of this paragraph (d) if this contract was awarded using other than sealed bid, is in excess of the simplified acquisition threshold, and does not contain the clause at 52.215-2, Audit and Records—Negotiation.

(1) The Comptroller General of the United States, or an authorized representative of the Comptroller General, shall have access to and right to examine any of the Contractor’s directly pertinent records involving transactions related to this contract.

(2) The Contractor shall make available at its offices at all reasonable times the records, materials, and other evidence for examination, audit, or reproduction, until 3 years after final payment under this contract or for any shorter period specified in FAR subpart 4.7, Contractor Records Retention, of the other clauses of this contract. If this contract is completely or partially terminated, the records relating to the work terminated shall be made available for 3 years after any resulting final termination settlement. Records relating to appeals under the disputes clause or to litigation or the settlement of claims arising under or relating to this contract shall be made available until such appeals, litigation, or claims are finally resolved.

(3) As used in this clause, records include books, documents, accounting procedures and practices, and other data, regardless of type and regardless of form. This does not require the Contractor to create or maintain any record that the Contractor does not maintain in the ordinary course of business or pursuant to a provision of law.

column1: (a) A contractor employee shall be identified both by the individual’s name and the contractor’s name when:

(2) When submitting any type of electronic correspondence to any NOAA employee or stakeholder.

(End of clause)

column2: NAM 1330-52.270-304 NOAA ACQUISITION AND GRANTS OFFICE OMBUDSMAN (OCT 2016)

column1: The NOAA Acquisition and Grants Office (AGO) Ombudsman is available to organizations to promote responsible and meaningful exchanges of information. Generally, the purpose of these exchanges will be to:

column2: Allow contractors to better prepare for and propose on business opportunities.
Advise as to technologies and solutions within the marketplace that the Government may not be aware of, or is not fully benefiting from.
Identify constraints in transparency and process.

The AGO Ombudsman will objectively, reasonably, and responsibly collaborate with parties and recommend fair, impartial, and constructive solutions to the matters presented to him/her. Further, the AGO Ombudsman will maintain the reasonable and responsible confidentiality of the source of a concern, when such a request has been formally made by an authorized officer of an organization seeking to do business with, or already doing business with NOAA.

Before consulting with the AGO Ombudsman, interested parties must first address their concerns, issues, disagreements, and/or recommendations with the respective contracting officer for resolution. However, direct access to the AGO Ombudsman may be sought when an interested party questions the objectivity or equity of a contracting officer’s decision, or when there is a bona fide reason to believe that reasonable, responsible, and objective consideration will not be received from an assigned contracting officer.
There are several constraints to the scope of the AGO Ombudsman’s authority, for instance:

Consulting with the AGO Ombudsman does not alter or postpone the timelines of any formal process (e.g., protests, claims, debriefings, employee employer actions, activities involving A76 competition performance decisions, judicial or congressional hearings, or proposal, amendment, modification or deliverable due dates, etc.).
The AGO Ombudsman cannot participate in the evaluation of proposals, source selection processes, or the adjudication of protests or formal contract disputes.
The AGO Ombudsman is not authorized to generate or alter laws, judicial decisions, rules, policies, or formal guidance.
The AGO Ombudsman is not authorized to develop or alter opportunity announcements, solicitations, contracts, or their terms or conditions.
The AGO Ombudsman cannot overrule the authorized decisions or determinations of the contracting officer.
The AGO Ombudsman has no authority to render a decision that binds AGO, NOAA, the Department of Commerce, or the U.S. Government.

The AGO Ombudsman is not NOAA’s agent relative to the service of magistrate or judicial process and cannot be used to extend service of process to another party (whether federal, public, or a private entity).

After review and analysis of a filed concern or recommendation, the AGO Ombudsman may refer the interested party to another more suitable federal official for consideration. Moreover, concerns, disagreements, and/or recommendations that cannot be resolved by the AGO Ombudsman will need to be pursued through more formal venues.

The AGO Ombudsman is not to be contacted to request copies of forms and/or documents under the purview of a contracting officer. Such documents include Requests for Information, solicitations, amendments, contracts, modifications, or conference materials.
Questions regarding this solicitation and contract language shall be directed to Rafael Roman, NOAA AGO Ombudsman, at Rafael.Roman@noaa.gov.

aec91c86fd0f4091b6a9b6e5b1ec8bff,80NSSC20740177Q,AOG Inertial Reference Unit for Gulfstream G-III,"V1.6 6/20
Synopsis:
NASA/NSSC has a requirement for Inertial Reference Unit.
NASA/NSSC will be the procuring center for this effort. Performance will be located at NASA/ Armstrong Flight Research Center (AFRC).
This notice is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice.

This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; offers are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2020-05. The Government intends to acquire commercial items and services using the provisions, clauses and procedures prescribed in FAR Part 12 and FAR Part 13.
This is a Request for Quotations (RFQ), 80NSSC20740177Q. Additional details are included in the attached RFQ file. The attached RFQ file is hereby incorporated into this solicitation.
Delivery is FOB Destination.
This Procurement is Set Aside for Small Business
The NAICS Code for this procurement is 336413

All responsible sources may submit a quote which shall be considered by the agency. However, any award from this RFQ shall require the potential vendor to be certified within the System for Award Management System (SAM) and completion of Reps and Certs in the SAM system prior to award at www.sam.gov.

Quotes for the item(s) described in the RFQ are due by 7/23/2020 by 2:00 p.m. CT to Philip M. Pearson at Philip.M.Pearson@nasa.gov in order to be considered for award. If it is in the best interest of the Government, quotes submitted after the due date may be accepted.
If the end product offered is other than a domestic end product as defined in the clause entitled "Buy American Act -- Supplies," the offeror shall so state and shall list the country of origin.

All contractual and technical questions must be in writing (e-mail) to Philip M. Pearson at Philip.M.Pearson@nasa.gov no later than 7/23/2020 by 10:00 a.m. CT. Telephone questions shall not be accepted.

The following clauses and provisions are applicable to this combined synopsis/solicitation: 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors; 52.212-3 Offeror Representations and Certifications— Commercial Items; 52.212-4 Contract Terms and Conditions—Commercial Items; 52-212-5 Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders— Commercial Items.
NASA Clause 1852.215-84, Ombudsman, is applicable. The Center Ombudsman for this acquisition can be found at http://prod.nais.nasa.gov/pub/pub_library/Omb.html .
The FAR may be obtained via the Internet at URL:

43c0dbb8da2748e99500979fdff20755,70Z02320I00000200,"RFI for Special Equipment, Supplies and LOX Equipment ,USCG C-130J aircraft","Request for Information for Gulfstream Aircraft Procurement

This Request for Information (RFI) serves as part of a market research effort by the United States Coast Guard (USCG) Office of Contracting Operations (CG-912) in support of the USCG Office of Aviation Acquisitions (CG-9311) Long Range Surveillance Program Office. All information received from this RFI will be used for planning and market research purposes only. Responses to the RFI become Government property and will not be returned. Respondents are advised that the U.S. Government will not pay for any information or administrative costs incurred in response to this RFI; all costs associated with responding to this RFI will be solely at the interested parties' expense.

Respondents are advised that the Government is under no obligation to provide feedback with respect to any information submitted. To the maximum extent possible, please submit non- proprietary information. Any proprietary information submitted should be identified as such and will be handled accordingly and protected from disclosure. Proprietary information will be safeguarded in accordance with the applicable Government regulations. The Government shall not be liable for damages related to proprietary information that is not properly identified.

Any submissions in response to this RFI constitutes consent for that submission to be reviewed by Government personnel and USCG Contractor employees supporting CG-9311, unless the respondent clearly objects in writing to the release of this information to USCG Contractor employees supporting CG-9311 in a cover letter accompanying the respondent's submission. All Government and USCG contractor personnel reviewing RFI responses will have signed non-disclosure agreements and understand their responsibility for proper use and protection from unauthorized disclosure of proprietary information.
1.0 - Description

This is a Request for Information (RFI) as defined in FAR 15.201(e). This RFI is issued in order to identify qualified sources for upcoming Aviation OEM supply provisioning & Distribution efforts for C-130J aircraft. In accordance with FAR 52.215-3, this RFI is issued solely for information and planning purposes; it does not constitute a Request for Proposal (RFP) or a promise to issue an RFP in the future. This RFI does not commit the Government to contract for any goods or services whatsoever. Further, the USCG is not at this time seeking proposals and will not accept unsolicited proposals. Respondents are reminded that the U.S. Government will not pay for any information or administrative costs incurred in response to this RFI; all costs associated with responding to this RFI will be solely at the interested party's expense. Not responding to this RFI does not preclude participation in any future RFP, if any is issued. If a solicitation is released, it will be synopsized on the beta.SAM.gov website. It is the responsibility of the potential respondents to monitor these sites for additional information pertaining to this requirement. The applicable NAICS code for this requirement is 336411 - Aircraft Manufacturing.
2.0 - Background

The Government is conducting market research to identify potential sources that possess Aviation supply chain management, support, and services. CG-912 & CG-9311, in support of the Lockheed Martin C-130J Aircraft Procurement is seeking information on how an interested contractor could enter into a contract that assists in the buildup of the USCG supply chain & initial inventory provisioning build up. This inventory bolstering directly effects USCG C-130J aircraft. The required supplies and materials may be delivered directly to the USCG Aviation Logistics Center in North Carolina or USCG Air Stations throughout the United States including AK, HI, and Puerto Rico in order to increase sparing materials used for the aircraft functionality or operational missions with respect to search & rescue, intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance functions.
3.0 - Questions to Industry
Interested potential sources should respond by answering the following questions:

1.    What are your company's capabilities and years of experience with regards to supply chain management, Aviation OEM expertise, Aviation OEM supply distribution, and Logistic Support personnel for continued market research as aircraft materials become diminished in availability? Claims of existing capabilities must be substantiated.

2.    Do you currently have a company-owned aviation logistics supply distribution facility, supply line, and supply personnel that can independently acquire / produce / manufacture / supply components (Parts, special tools, equipment, etc.) found specifically on or associated with Lockheed Martin C-130J aircraft? Where is it located? What is the capacity to support the supply and demand of parts, materials (repairable or consumable), or tooling?
3.    What type of warranties are offered as part of new C-130J aircraft components, parts, materials, equipment or tooling?

4.    Regarding the RFI attachments materials list, what is the timeline to provide new C-130J aircraft components, parts, materials, equipment or tooling to the USCG starting at contract award? (Ideal contract type is IDIQ or catalogue)
5.    Do you own or similarly hold the rights to any technical data to manufacture or distribute any Lockheed Martin C-130J aircraft components, parts, materials, equipment or tooling?

6.    What is your company's ability to enter into a support contract or an IDIQ contract with the USCG for 3-5 years of support to the C-130J aircraft components, parts, materials, equipment or tooling?

7.    What percentage of the RFI attachments materials list can be supplied to the USCG in its entirety? (As in, of 200 items listed, 100 can be supported, thus 50% of listed items are supportable; the additional 100 items are not obtainable by our organization). What items can be supported, please list in a table format.

8.    Of the items listed that can be supported from the RFI attachments – which items can be delivered to the USCG ALC or an Air Station located in the United States including AK, HI, and Puerto Rico by October 2021?

9.    Minus any potential additional distribution fees or management cost, what are the direct current/retail OEM cost per component listed in the RFI attachments? (This information is used to confirm USCG budget expectations and known assumptions)
4.0 - Instructions
The following Business Unit Information must be provided in the response documentation:
QUALIFICATION INFORMATION:
a. Company Name:
b. Address:
c. CAGE Code:
d. DUNS number:
e. Point of Contract/Phone Number:
f. E-mail Address:
g. Company Size (number of personnel, total revenue, ownership, Parent Corporation, etc.):
h. NAICS Code:
i. Length of time in business:
j. Answers to all Questions from section 3.0
5.0 - Industry Discussions

Following the Government's assessment of responses to this RFI, the Government may conduct discussions with Industry. If the Government does, this information will be provided via beta.SAM.gov notice.
6.0 - Additional Instructions
Please see attached PDF -  List  of Special Equipment, Supplies and LOX Equipment

Questions regarding this announcement shall be submitted to Domingo Cruz in writing by e-mail at Domingo.cruz2@uscg.mil. Verbal questions will NOT be accepted. Questions will be answered by e-mail; accordingly, questions shall NOT contain proprietary or classified information. The Government does not guarantee that questions received after 30 days of the publication date of this RFI will be answered.

This Request for Information does not constitute a Request for Proposal and is not to be construed as a request for an offer. Therefore, there will be no evaluation of responses to this notice for contract award purposes. Reimbursement will not be made for any cost associated with providing information in response to this announcement and any follow-up information requests.

Responses and Questions regarding this notice shall be submitted in writing to Domingo Cruz by email at Domingo.cruz2@uscg.mil with a carbon copy to Matthew.L.Wallace@uscg.mil no later than Friday, July 01th 2020 at 12:00 PM (EST). Proprietary information, if any, should be minimized and MUST BE CLEARLY MARKED. Please be advised that submissions will not be returned.

69cf12e4d2da4fcd9ffaa50bba658e32,70Z03820QS0000004,Procurement of Overhauled Auxiliary Power Unit,This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Subpart 12.6 and 13.5 as supplemented with additional information included in this notice.  This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; firm-fixed-price quotations are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued.
The solicitation number is 70Z03820QS0000004.  The solicitation is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ).
The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2020-06.

The Department of Homeland Security, United States Coast Guard (USCG), Aviation Logistics Center located in Elizabeth City, North Carolina proposes to enter into a purchase order with firm-fixed-pricing on a basis other than full and open competition pursuant to the statutory authority cited in 41 U.S.C. 1901(c) as implemented by FAR 13.501(a), sole source (including brand name) acquisitions.
The USCG intends to award a purchase order with firm-fixed-pricing on a sole source basis to the Original Equipment Manufacturer, Honeywell International Inc. Cage Code 99193.
In order for offers to be considered technically acceptable, offerors shall submit the following with their quotation:

column2: Proof of possession of the most current Honeywell Overhaul Procedures Manual by providing a copy of the cover page of the manual.
Proof of possession of the most current service bulletins by providing a copy of the cover page of the service bulletins.
Provide a certified copy of the company’s Federal Aviation Administration Repair Center Certificate.
Provide a copy of the company’s warranty of item to be provided.

column1: Offers may be considered technically unacceptable if the offeror fails to submit the information listed above with their quotation.
Pricing must be determined fair and reasonable before making award.
All responsible sources may submit a capability statement or quotation, which shall be considered by the agency.

The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code for this acquisition is 336413, Other Aircraft Parts and Auxiliary Equipment Manufacturing.  The small business size standard is 1,250 employees.

This requirement is for the procurement of one (1) each overhauled Auxiliary Power Unit (APU), National Stock Number 2835-01-550-9862, Part Number WE-3800700-1, for installation and use on the USCG owned Gulfstream Model G-5, Serial Number 653 aircraft.  The aircraft APU is an electric generator that powers the electrical system when the aircraft’s main engines are off.  It also provides pneumatic pressure for starting the main engines.  The aircraft APU is a flight critical component.

The APU shall be overhauled in accordance with the most current Honeywell overhaul procedures and service bulletins.  The overhauled APU shall include all new life limited parts and shall be tested with the highest level of testing in test cell (heavy criteria) available.  The overhauled APU shall come with a Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) certification.
Offerors shall be able to provide proof of possession of the most current Honeywell Overhaul Procedures Manual, Service Bulletins, and FAA Repair Center Certificate.
Required delivery is 180 calendar days after receipt of the order.
Place of delivery is:
United States Coast Guard
Air Station Washington
1 Reagan National Airport
MS7600 Hangar 6
Washington, DC 20598-7600
Inspection and acceptance is: Point of Contact
FOB Point is destination.
The following documents are attached:
Attachment 1: Schedule
Attachment 2: Terms and Conditions

Quotations shall be submitted electronically to Brandy Moneymaker, Contract Specialist, at Brandy.L.Moneymaker@uscg.mil and Ryan Suchy, Contracting Officer, at Ryan.M.Suchy@uscg.mil.  Please indicate SOLICITATION NUMBER: 70Z03820QS0000004 in the subject line.
Anticipated award date is on or about 07/30/20.
NOTICE FOR FILING AGENCY PROTESTS
United States Coast Guard Ombudsman Program

It is the policy of the United States Coast Guard (USCG) to issue solicitations and make contract awards in a fair and timely manner. The Ombudsman Program for Agency Protests (OPAP) was established to investigate agency protest issues and resolve them without expensive and time-consuming litigation. OPAP is an independent reviewing authority that is empowered to grant a prevailing protester essentially the same relief as the Government Accountability Office (GAO).

Interested parties are encouraged to seek resolution of their concerns within the USCG as an Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) forum rather than filing a protest with the GAO or some external forum. Interested parties may seek resolution of their concerns informally or opt to file a formal agency protest with the Contracting Officer or Ombudsman.

Informal Forum with the Ombudsman. Interested parties who believe a specific USCG procurement is unfair or otherwise defective should first direct their concerns to the applicable Contracting Officer. If the Contracting Officer is unable to satisfy their concerns, interested parties are encouraged to contact the U.S. Coast Guard Ombudsman for Agency Protests. Under this informal process the agency is not required to suspend contract award performance. Use of an informal forum does not suspend any time requirement for filing a protest with the agency or other forum. In order to ensure a timely response, interested parties should provide the following information to the Ombudsman: solicitation/contract number, contracting office, Contracting Officer, and solicitation closing date (if applicable).

Formal Agency Protest with the Ombudsman. Prior to submitting a formal agency protest, protesters must first use their best efforts to resolve their concerns with the Contracting Officer through open and frank discussions. If the protester’s concerns are unresolved, an Independent Review is available by the Ombudsman. The protester may file a formal agency protest to either the Contracting Officer or as an alternative to that, the Ombudsman under the OPAP program. Contract award or performance will be suspended during the protest period unless contract award or performance is justified, in writing, for urgent and compelling reasons or is determined in writing to be in the best interest of the Government. The agency’s goal is to resolve protests in less than 35 calendar days from the date of filing. Protests shall include the information set forth in FAR 33.103(d) (2). If the protester fails to submit the required information, resolution of the protest may be delayed or the protest may be dismissed. To be timely protests must be filed within the period specified in FAR 33.103(e). Formal protests filed under the OPAP program should be submitted electronically to OPAP@uscg.mil and the Contracting Officer or by hand delivery to the Contracting Officer.

Election of Forum. After an interested party protests a Coast Guard procurement to the Contracting Officer or the Ombudsman, and while the protest is pending, the protester agrees not to file a protest with the GAO or other external forum. If the protest is filed with an external forum, the agency protest will be dismissed.
The Ombudsman Hotline telephone number is 202.372.3695.

70faa26bd519419a8045f973faee206d,80NSSC20733318Q,Gulfstream III (C-20) Maintenance,"V1.0 4-16
Synopsis:
NASA/NSSC has a requirement for Gulfstream III (C-20) Maintenance.
NASA/NSSC will be the procuring center for this effort. Performance will be located at NASA/ Langley Research Center (LARC).
This notice is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice.

This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; offers are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2020-03. The Government intends to acquire commercial items and services using the provisions, clauses and procedures prescribed in FAR Part 12 and FAR Part 13.
This is a Request for Quotations (RFQ), 80NSSC20733318Q. Additional details are included in the attached RFQ file. The attached RFQ file is hereby incorporated into this solicitation.
Delivery is FOB Destination.
This Procurement is Set Aside for Small Business

The NAICS Code for this procurement is 336413 All responsible sources may submit a quote which shall be considered by the agency. However, any award from this RFQ shall require the potential vendor to be certified within the System for Award Management System (SAM) and completion of Reps and Certs in the SAM system prior to award at www.sam.gov. Quotes for the item(s) described in the RFQ are due by 6/5/2020 by 1:00 p.m. CT to Philip M. Pearson at Philip.M.Pearson@nasa.gov in order to be considered for award. If it is in the best interest of the Government, quotes submitted after the due date may be accepted.
If the end product offered is other than a domestic end product as defined in the clause entitled "Buy American Act -- Supplies," the offeror shall so state and shall list the country of origin.

All contractual and technical questions must be in writing (e-mail) to Philip M. Pearson at Philip.M.Pearson@nasa.gov no later than 6/4/2020 by 1:00 p.m. CT. Telephone questions shall not be accepted.
The following clauses and provisions are applicable to this combined synopsis/solicitation: 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors; 52.212-3 Offeror Representations and Certifications—
Commercial Items; 52.212-4 Contract Terms and Conditions—Commercial Items; 52-212-5 Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders— Commercial Items.
NASA Clause 1852.215-84, Ombudsman, is applicable. The Center Ombudsman for this acquisition can be found at http://prod.nais.nasa.gov/pub/pub_library/Omb.html .
The FAR may be obtained via the Internet at URL:
http://www.acquisition.gov/far/index.html
The NFS may be obtained via the Internet at URL: http://www.hq.nasa.gov/office/procurement/regs/nfstoc.html

Offerors must include completed copies of the provision at 52.212.3 Offeror Representations and Certifications-Commercial Items with their offer. These representations and certifications will be incorporated by reference in any resultant contract.
Contracting Office Address:
NASA Shared Services Center, Jerry Hlass Rd. Stennis Space Center, MS 39529

8ee36c5e6b5145d7ac91ecd3479050cc,NMAN6000-20-01191,NOAA AOC GULFSTREAM PLANE BOOK SUB,"NOTICE OF INTENT TO NEGOTIATE A SOLE-SOURCE CONTRACT

The US Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Marine and Aviation Operations (OMAO), Aircraft Operations Center requires a recurring subscription of electronic checklist and aircraft technical publication data to NOAA Air Operations Center Aircraft N49RF, Gulfstream IV model aircraft.

The service will be conducted by: Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation, P.O. Box 730349, Dallas, Texas 75373-0349. To provide GIV-PlaneBook Software-App, Annual Renewal for: 06/16/2020 -- 06/16/2021, AC Serial No./Tail No.: 1246 / N49RF.
The North American Industry Classification Code (NAICS) for this acquisition is 336411, Aircraft Manufacturing; the small business size standard is 1,500 Employees.
GIV-OL2A-APP Annual renewal for 6/16/2020-6/16/2021, for AC Serial No. 1246 / N49RF
The Government is not aware of any other vendors that are authorized to provide, service, or support of any Gulfstream Aerospace software without compromising OEM delivery, or additional markups.

The Government intends to acquire this service under the guidelines of FAR Part 13, Simplified Acquisitions Procedures and FAR Part 12, Commercial Items. The Government intends to solicit and negotiate directly with Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation, under the authority of FAR 13.106-1(b)(1)(i).

This is not a solicitation for competitive quotes. However, if any authorized party that can provide this subscription/licensing without compromising manufacturing delivery or mark ups may submit a statement of capabilities, which if in timely received, will be considered by NOAA OMAO.

A statement of capabilities to include the detailed service including manufacture authorization, and OEM agreement, and a price list, this shall be received by 5:00pm EST on June 5, 2020. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed requirement is based upon responses to this notice and it is solely within the discretion of the Government.

Information received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement in the future. Evidence must be provided of the required service while also be authorized by the manufacture.

The capability statement, a price list and any other information furnished must be in writing and must contain material in sufficient detail to allow the Government to determine if the party can meet all of the system requirements. Capability statements and related materials must be e-mailed to Christopher Baker at Christopher.Baker@noaa.gov by 5:00pm EST on June 5, 2020.
